subject: Math
title: Graphing Quadratic Functions
description: Learn to graph parabolas and identify key features

content.text: The graph of a quadratic function is called a parabola. Understanding how to graph parabolas helps us visualize solutions and real-world applications.

content.heading: Key Features of a Parabola
content.text:
• Vertex: the highest or lowest point
• Axis of symmetry: vertical line through vertex
• Y-intercept: where graph crosses y-axis (0, c)
• X-intercepts (roots): where graph crosses x-axis
• Direction: opens up (a > 0) or down (a < 0)

content.heading: Axis of Symmetry
content.text:
For f(x) = ax² + bx + c, the axis of symmetry is:

x = -b/(2a)

The x-coordinate of the vertex lies on this line.

content.heading: Example 1
content.problem: Find the axis of symmetry for f(x) = x² - 6x + 5

content.heading: Example 2
content.problem: Find the vertex of f(x) = x² - 4x + 3
